Detailed Description

TREX timeline representation.

This class is used by TREX ot represent a timeline and its connection with reactors. It is used internally to miantin the relation graph betwen reactors as well as the observation and goal exchanges for this given timeline

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

the timeline is not owned

timeline::timeline ( TICK  date,
utils::Symbol const &  name,
TeleoReactor &  serv 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
[in] date The current tick
[in] name A symbolic name
[in] serv A reactor

Creates the timeline name and makes serv its owner. It also creates the default observation Failed staring from date which should be replaced by an observation from serv

Postcondition:
the timeline is owned by serv
See also:

bool TREX::transaction::details::timeline::active (  )  const [inline]

Check if active.

Checks if this timeline is owned by a reactor and has at least one client. In such case the timeline should be explored during the traversal of the reactors relation graph

See also:

TICK timeline::latency (  )  const

Timeline latency.

Indicates the timeline latency. As opposed to a reactor latency This latency not only include the deliberation time to include a token in a plan but also includes the maximum time it will take for the requested goal to be observed. It is actually what is called the execution latency identified by getExecLatency method for a reactor

Note:
If the timeline has no reactor its latency is set to the default value 0. Thids may change in the future
See also:
TeleoReactor::getExecLatency() const

Definition at line 76 of file Relation.cc.

TICK timeline::look_ahead (  )  const

Timeline look ahead.

Reflects the look ahaed of the reactor owning this timeline. This insdicates how far ahead a goal can be posted to the timeline. If the timlien does not accpet goals is look ahead is 0

Note:
the look_ahead of a timelien can change. This happens specifically when the owner of the timeline changes.
Returns:
the timeline look-ahead
See also:
TeleoReactor::getLookAhead() const TeleoReactor::latency()
